get.description:
If no `Location` is provided, all matter types from all locations will be returned (paginated)
Sample request:
            
    GET /mattertypes

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: Searches for partial match on matter type name

parameters.name: Location
parameters.description: Return matter types from a specific location. In the US API this is the ANSI 2 letter state code (e.g. IL, NY). In the AU API this is shorthand state code (e.g. NSW, ACT, etc)

parameters.name: Category
parameters.description: Return matter types from a specific category.

fileName.description: Full name of the file including the file extension

folderId.description: Id of the folder to add the file to. If null it will be placed in the root folder

dateCreated.description: The original datetime that the file was created. If null the current datetime will be used

fileName.description: Full name of the file including the file extension

folderId.description: Id of the folder to add the file to. If null it will be placed in the root folder

fileName.description:
The name of the attachment file. Mandatory field.
Accepted file types are: jpeg, jpg, pdf, png.

AddAttachmentDto.description: This object holds data for a request to upload an expense attachment.

expenseId.description: The id of the expense that a file will be uploaded to.

uploadUrl.description: The URL for uploading the file.

AddAttachmentInfo.description: Return value for a request to add an expense attachemnt.

staffId.description: The id of the staff member linked to the expense.

matterId.description: The id of the matter that the expense belongs to.

subject.description: The subject - this is a short description of the expense.

description.description: Optional detailed description of the expense.

quantity.description:
The quantity of the expense in units (if not applicable, use 1). 
The expense amount will be calculated as Quantity * Price.

price.description:
The price of the expense in dollars.
Limited to 2 decimal places (cents).
The expense amount will be calculated as Quantity * Price.

amount.description:
Total amount of the expense. Calculated as Price * Quantity.
This amount ignores GST (if applicable). See Billing.Expenses.API.Resources.Expense.AmountExcTax and Billing.Expenses.API.Resources.Expense.AmountIncTax.

amountExcTax.description:
Amount excluding tax. Calculated from Amount and Tax depending on the TaxInclusive property.
If tax is not applicable (outside AU), this will be the same as Amount.

amountIncTax.description:
Amount including tax. Calculated from Amount and Tax depending on the TaxInclusive property.
If tax is not applicable (outside AU), this will be the same as Amount.

tax.description: GST amount of the expense in dollars. Only applicable in AU.

taxInclusive.description:
If true, the amount is GST inclusive, otherwise GST exclusive. Only applicable in AU.
GST inclusive means: Amount exc. GST = Amount - GST, Amount inc. GST = Amount.
GST exclusive means: Amount exc. GST = Amount, Amount inc. GST = Amount + GST.
(Amount = Price * Quantity, GST = value of the Tax field)

isBillable.description:
True if the expense is billable. Non-billable expense will, by default, not be shown on invoices
(and, if shown, the amount will be 0).

isWrittenOff.description:
True if the expense is written off. True only allowed if IsBillable is true. 
Written off expenses will show on an invoice with their amount, but will not be counted in the invoice total.

expenseDate.description: The date of the expense. Mandatory field.

staffId.description: The id of the staff member linked to the expense. Mandatory field.

subject.description: The subject - this should be a short description of the expense. Mandatory field.

description.description: Optional detailed description of the expense.

quantity.description:
The quantity of the expense in units (if not applicable, use 1). Must be a non-negative number.
Limited to 2 decimal places.
The expense amount will be calculated as Quantity * Price.

price.description:
The price of the expense in dollars. Must be a non-negative number.
Limited to 2 decimal places (cents).
The expense amount will be calculated as Quantity * Price.

tax.description: GST amount of the expense in dollars. Only applicable in AU.

taxInclusive.description:
If true, the amount is GST inclusive, otherwise GST exclusive. Only applicable in AU.
GST inclusive means: Amount exc. GST = Amount - GST, Amount inc. GST = Amount.
GST exclusive means: Amount exc. GST = Amount, Amount inc. GST = Amount + GST.
(Amount = Price * Quantity, GST = value of the Tax field)

isBillable.description:
True if the expense is billable. Non-billable expense will, by default, not be shown on invoices
(and, if shown, the amount will be 0).

isWrittenOff.description:
True if the expense is written off. True only allowed if IsBillable is true. 
Written off expenses will show on an invoice with their amount, but will not be counted in the invoice total.

externalSystemId.description: Id of this matter in an external system

createdDateUtc.description: Will default to the current datetime
